Title: Object: Egyptian Monuments
Description: "Egyptian Monuments, in the British Museum, collected by the Institute in Egypt, under the Direction of Buonaparte, and Surrendered to the British Commander in Cheif, Lord Hutchinson, by General Menou" (London, Longman, Hurst, Rees & Orme; T. Medland; W. Miller) 1805-1807; 21 prints representing ancient Egyptian sarcophagi, obelisks etc., bound into an album with letterpress subscription announcement and list of subscribers pasted at the front. Plate 3 is fold-out. Aquatints, some printed in colours Etchings
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Associated with: John Hely Hutchinson, 2nd Earl of Donoughmore
Associated with: Jacques François (Abdallah) de Menou
Acquisition notes: This book was entered in the 1837 inventory as Mm,6. and the old number is still written on the spine of the binding. The 'Book of Donations' records on 11 May 1811 a gift from William Alexander (then Keeper of Prints and Drawings) of the '5th no. of Egyptian Antiquities', and this suggests that it was he who gave this series to the BM.
